derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the ecclesiastical sense): from late Latin metropolitanus, from Greek mētropolitēs 'citizen of a mother state', from mētropolis (see metropolis)

entry.def: Metropolitan means belonging to or typical of a large busy city.
A metropolitan is an important priest in the Orthodox and Catholic Churches. He has authority over other priests and is in charge of a particular area.

example.ex: ...the Ukrainian Catholic representatives, Metropolitan Volodymyr and Bishop Sofron.
example.tran: 乌克兰的天主教代表——弗拉基米尔大主教和索夫龙主教

means.word_mean: 1. in the Eastern Orthodox Church this title is given to a position between bishop and patriarch; equivalent to archbishop in western Christianity
2. a person who lives in a metropolis
1. relating to or characteristic of a metropolis;
